tp.pr5

Class RobotEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.Observable<RobotEngineObserver>
      • tp.pr5.RobotEngine

  • public class RobotEngine
extends Observable<RobotEngineObserver>

    This class represents the robot engine. It controls robot movements by processing the instructions provided by the controllers. The engine stops when the robot arrives at the space ship, runs out of fuel or receives a quit instruction.

    The robot engine is also responsible for updating the fuel level and the recycled material according to the actions that the robot performs in the city.

    The robot engine contains an inventory, where the robot stores the items that it collects from the city

    Author:
    Purificacion Arenas, Guillermo Jimenez

      Creates the robot engine in an initial place, facing an initial direction and with a city map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotEngine

        public RobotEngine(City map,
           Place initialPlace,
           Direction direction)
        Creates the robot engine in an initial place, facing an initial direction and with a city map. Initially the robot has not any items or recycled material but it has an initial amount of fuel (100).
        Parameters:
        cityMap - The city where the robot wanders
        initialPlace - The place where the robot starts
        direction - The initial direction where the robot is facing.

    • Method Detail

      • communicateRobot

        public void communicateRobot(Instruction c)
        It executes an instruction. The instruction must be configured with the context before executing it. It controls the end of the simulation. If the execution of the instruction throws an exception, then the corresponding message is printed
        Parameters:
        c - The instruction to be executed

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Checks if the simulation is finished
        Returns:
        true if the game has finished
